title_full:
TNT Roots

              —
              Raw Dub Creator
            
              (Bokeh Versions)
label: Bokeh Versions
description:
Earth-shattering, warm-charming dub pressure from the mighty TNT Roots, dished up as a special debut LP proper following a run of 12”s and dubs you’ll never see but might hear in Aba Shanti or Iration Steppers sets

An original, pivotal member of the Earthquake crew, whose militant digidub steppers have fuelled so many UK dances since 1993, TNT Roots brings... more

label: Berceuse Heroique
description:
Jay Glass Dubs’ metamorphosis into avant-dub-noise songwriting sloshes to new high water marks in ’Soma’, following a pair of ace twelves with a full 2LP of all-over-the-place brilliance for Berceuse Heroique, somewhere between @mbient pop, gnashing junglist drums and squashed trip hop - often all at once.

Keening between trampling, wrenched roots... more

title_full:
Om Unit Meets Seekersinternational

              —
              Secret Location
            
              (Berceuse Heroique)
label: Berceuse Heroique
description:
Coordinates to the haunted dancehall, dialling in the ghosts of ‘90s hardcore jungle, hip hop and bashment in a psycho-dubwise style for Berceuse Heroique - BIG RIYL Lee Gamble, Peder Mannerfelt, Ossia, Karim Maas

Halfstep specialist Om Unit and mixing desk mavericks Seekerinternational make an ideal, if unpredicted, partnership on seven tracks that... more

title_full:
Cindy Lee

              —
              What's Tonight To Eternity
            
              (W.25TH / Superior Viaduct)
label: W.25TH / Superior Viaduct
description:
Very strong slab of haunted ‘60s pop themes and keeling synth noise from Canada’s Pat Flegel aka Cindy Lee, formerly of Canadian indie-pop heroes Women, now sounding like a spell concocted by Panda Bear, Forest Swords, Johnny Jewel and Dean Hurley’s Trouble. Check the samples and trust your ears, it’s a bewt!

“For Patrick Flegel, Cindy Lee is more... more

title_full:
Dead Space Chamber Music

            —
            Hagioscope Obscura

J.H. Guraj

              —
              Introspection / Migration
            
              (Maple Death Records)
label: Maple Death Records
description:
Story-telling, lyrical guitar artistry from J.H. Guraj, an enigmatic project by Italian artist Dominique Vaccaro, surely resonating with Sir Richard Bishop, Ben Chasny and Loren Connors styles

Detectably inflected with a smoky Middle Eastern accent, Vaccaro’s playing on ‘Introspection / Migration’ inhabits his J.H. Guraj character with a firelick spirit and... more

title_full:
Dijit

              —
              Hyperattention - Selected Dijital Works vol 1
            
              (Youth)
label: Youth
description:
Mesmerising debut album of blue and abstracted trip hop from Cairo's Dijit, making their first appearance for Andy Lyster’s YOUTH with a smoked-out, downbeat sound reminding us of Leila’s uber-classic debut album ‘Like Weather', Tricky’s Pre-Millennium Tension, with echoes of Tirzah, ZULI and Msylma.

Perfectly low-lit and charged with a slow, nocturnal... more

"Special Interest have returned with their sophomore LP. A dual release from Night School (EU) and Thrilling Living (US). The Passion Of... combines elements of glam rock and no wave pushed through a mangled filter of contemporary... more

title_full:
Heather Leigh

              —
              Glory Days (Vinyl Edition)
            
              (Boomkat Editions | Documenting Sound)
label: Vinyl Edition
description: Heather Leigh is a musical polymath in the truest sense of the word; primarily known as an influential practitioner of pedal steel guitar, her work is impossible to pigeonhole - all-over-the-place in the best way, from collaborations with Peter Brötzmann and Shackleton to a properly mind-bending duo of albums for Stephen O’Malley’s Ideologic Organ and... more

title_full:
Jabu, Daniela Dyson

              —
              Jabu & Daniela Dyson
            
              (do you have peace?)
label: do you have peace?
description:
Slowtime ambient soul music from the DIY heart of Bristol, introducing Jabu’s new label; do you have peace?

Emerging from the scene revolving Young Echo, No Corner, and Blackest Ever Black (R.I.P.), Jabu trio of Amos Childs, Jasmine Butt and Alex Rendall meet their pals, Vessel, Sunun and Rakhi Singh to conjure an intimate, familial atmosphere and headspace... more
